AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT AIRSPEED HOLD
AutopilotVariables.Desc: returns whether airspeed hold is active (1, TRUE) or not (0, FALSE).

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT AIRSPEED HOLD VAR
AutopilotVariables.Desc: Returns the target holding airspeed for the autopilot.

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT AIRSPEED MAX CALCULATED
AutopilotVariables.Desc: Returns the maximum calculated airspeed (kcas) limit set for the autopilot.

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT AIRSPEED MIN CALCULATED
AutopilotVariables.Desc: Returns the minimum calculated airspeed (kcas) limit set for the autopilot.

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT ALT RADIO MODE
AutopilotVariables.Desc: If enabled the Autopilot will use the Radio Altitude rather than the Indicated Altitude.

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT ALTITUDE ARM
AutopilotVariables.Desc: Returns whether the autopilot is in Altitude Arm mode (1, TRUE) or not (0, FALSE).

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT ALTITUDE LOCK
AutopilotVariables.Desc: Altitude hold active

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT ALTITUDE LOCK VAR
AutopilotVariables.Desc: Set or get the slot index which the altitude hold mode will track when captured. See alt_mode_slot_index for more information.

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT ALTITUDE MANUALLY TUNABLE
AutopilotVariables.Desc: Whether or not the autopilot altitude is manually tunable or not.

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT ALTITUDE SLOT INDEX
AutopilotVariables.Desc: Index of the slot that the autopilot will use for the altitude reference. Note that there are 3 slots (1, 2, 3) that you can set/get normally, however you can also target slot index 0. Writing to slot 0 will overwrite all other slots with the slot 0 value, and by default the autopilot will follow slot 0 if you have not selected any slot index. See alt_mode_slot_index for more information.

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT APPROACH ACTIVE
AutopilotVariables.Desc: When true, the autopilot is currently flying the approach Flight Plan (the last legs).

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT APPROACH ARM
AutopilotVariables.Desc: Returns true when the autopilot is active on the approach, once it reaches the adequate condition (in most cases, once it reaches the second-last waypoint of the flightplan).

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT APPROACH CAPTURED
AutopilotVariables.Desc: Returns true when the lateral NAV mode is engaged and the angular deviation with the current tuned navigation frequency is less than 5Â°.

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT APPROACH HOLD
AutopilotVariables.Desc: Returns whether pproach mode is active (1, TRUE) or not (0, FALSE).

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT APPROACH IS LOCALIZER
AutopilotVariables.Desc: Returns true if the current approach is using a localizer.

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT ATTITUDE HOLD
AutopilotVariables.Desc: Attitude hold active

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT AVAILABLE
AutopilotVariables.Desc: Available flag

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT AVIONICS MANAGED
AutopilotVariables.Desc: Returns whether the autopilot has active managed avionics (1, TRUE) or not (0, FALSE).

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT BACKCOURSE HOLD
AutopilotVariables.Desc: Returns whether the autopilot back course mode is active (1, TRUE) or not (0, FALSE).

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT BANK HOLD
AutopilotVariables.Desc: Returns whether the autopilot bank hold mode is active (1, TRUE) or not (0, FALSE).

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT BANK HOLD REF
AutopilotVariables.Desc: The current bank-hold bank reference. Note: that if you set this, the next frame the value will be overwritten by the engine, so you may need to write to this every game frame to ensure it maintains the required value.

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT DEFAULT PITCH MODE
AutopilotVariables.Desc: The current default pitch mode of the autopilot as configured in the plane configuration with the parameter default_pitch_mode.

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT DEFAULT ROLL MODE
AutopilotVariables.Desc: The current default roll mode of the autopilot as configured in the plane configuration with the parameter default_bank_mode.

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT DISENGAGED
AutopilotVariables.Desc: Returns whether the autopilot has been disengaged (1, TRUE) or not (0, FALSE).

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT GLIDESLOPE ACTIVE
AutopilotVariables.Desc: When true, the autopilot is receiving a signal from the runway beacon and is following the slope to reach the ground.

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT GLIDESLOPE ARM
AutopilotVariables.Desc: Returns true when the autopilot is active on the glide slope.

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT GLIDESLOPE HOLD

Note that there are 3 slots (1, 2, 3) that you can set/get normally, however you can also target slot index 0. Writing to slot 0 will overwrite all other slots with the slot 0 value, and by default the autopilot will follow slot 0 if you have not selected any slot index.

AutopilotVariables.Desc: Mach hold active

AutopilotVariables.Desc: Returns whether the autopilot managed throttle is active (1, TRUE) or not (0, FALSE).

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT TAKEOFF POWER ACTIVE
AutopilotVariables.Desc: Takeoff / Go Around power mode active

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT THROTTLE ARM
AutopilotVariables.Desc: Returns whether the autopilot auto-throttle is armed (1, TRUE) or not (0, FALSE).

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT THROTTLE MAX THRUST
AutopilotVariables.Desc: This can be used to set/get the thrust lever position for autopilot maximum thrust.

AutopilotVariables.Name: AUTOPILOT VERTICAL HOLD

ElectricalVariables.Name: BUS LOOKUP INDEX
ElectricalVariables.Desc: This is a settable simvar meaning that it can both be read and set. Some of the simvars in this list are using this to lookup a value using two arguments (one argument in addition to the component index). For example to check the state of the connection between a "circuit.45" and the "bus.2" it would be written as follows: 2 (>A:BUS LOOKUP INDEX, Number) (A:CIRCUIT CONNECTION ON:45, Bool) It should be notes that when BUS_LOOKUP_INDEX is not set (ie: it is 0) then TRUE will be returned if any of your bus connections are on.

ElectricalVariables.Name: BUS BREAKER PULLED
ElectricalVariables.Desc: This will be true if the bus breaker is pulled. Requires a BUS_LOOKUP_INDEX and a bus index.

ElectricalVariables.Name: BUS CONNECTION ON
ElectricalVariables.Desc: This will be true if the bus is connected. Requires a BUS_LOOKUP_INDEX and a bus index.

ElectricalVariables.Name: ELECTRICAL GENALT LOAD
ElectricalVariables.Desc: This returns the percentage of the load output that is being consumed. This requires an alternator index when referencing.

ElectricalVariables.Name: ELECTRICAL GENALT BUS AMPS
ElectricalVariables.Desc: The load handled by the alternator. This requires an alternator index when referencing.

ElectricalVariables.Name: ELECTRICAL GENALT BUS VOLTAGE
ElectricalVariables.Desc: General alternator voltage. This requires an alternator index when referencing.

ElectricalVariables.Name: ELECTRICAL MAIN BUS VOLTAGE
ElectricalVariables.Desc: The main bus voltage. Use a bus index when referencing.

EnvironmentVariables.Name: ABSOLUTE TIME
EnvironmentVariables.Desc: This returns the seconds since 12:00 am 1/1/1AD Zulu Time See the Note On Zulu Time for more information.

EnvironmentVariables.Name: ZULU TIME
EnvironmentVariables.Desc: This returns the seconds since midnight (00:00 Zulu Time) on the current day.

EnvironmentVariables.Name: ZULU DAY OF WEEK
EnvironmentVariables.Desc: This returns the current Zulu Time day of the week as an integer value between 0 and 6 (inclusive), where 0 is Sunday and 6 is Saturday. See the Note On Zulu Time for more information.

EnvironmentVariables.Name: ZULU DAY OF MONTH
EnvironmentVariables.Desc: This returns the current Zulu Time day of the month as an integer value between 1 and 31 (inclusive). See the Note On Zulu Time for more information.

EnvironmentVariables.Name: ZULU MONTH OF YEAR
EnvironmentVariables.Desc: This returns the current Zulu Time month of the year as an integer value between 1 and 12 (inclusive), where 1 is January and 12 is December. See the Note On Zulu Time for more information.

EnvironmentVariables.Name: ZULU DAY OF YEAR
EnvironmentVariables.Desc: This returns the current Zulu Time day of the year as an integer value between 0 and 365 (365 only on a leap year). See the Note On Zulu Time for more information.

EnvironmentVariables.Name: ZULU YEAR
EnvironmentVariables.Desc: This returns the current Zulu Time year as an integer value. See the Note On Zulu Time for more information.

EnvironmentVariables.Name: ZULU SUNRISE TIME
EnvironmentVariables.Desc: This returns the seconds since midnight until the sunrise based on Zulu Time. See the Note On Zulu Time for more information.

EnvironmentVariables.Name: ZULU SUNSET TIME
EnvironmentVariables.Desc: This returns the seconds since midnight until the sunset based on Zulu Time. See the Note On Zulu Time for more information.

EnvironmentVariables.Name: LOCAL TIME
EnvironmentVariables.Desc: This returns the seconds since midnight (00:00 local time) on the current day.

EnvironmentVariables.Name: LOCAL DAY OF WEEK
EnvironmentVariables.Desc: This returns the current day of the week as an integer value between 0 and 6 (inclusive), where 0 is Monday and 6 is Sunday, within the local time reference.

EnvironmentVariables.Name: LOCAL DAY OF MONTH
EnvironmentVariables.Desc: This returns the current day of the month as an integer value between 1 and 31 (inclusive), within the local time reference.

EnvironmentVariables.Name: LOCAL MONTH OF YEAR
EnvironmentVariables.Desc: This returns the current month of the year as an integer value between 1 and 12 (inclusive), where 1 is January and 12 is December, within the local time reference.

EnvironmentVariables.Name: LOCAL DAY OF YEAR
EnvironmentVariables.Desc: This returns the current day of the year as an integer value between 0 and 365 (365 only on a leap year), within the local time reference.

EnvironmentVariables.Name: LOCAL YEAR
EnvironmentVariables.Desc: This returns the current year (local time) as an integer value.

EnvironmentVariables.Name: TIME ZONE OFFSET
EnvironmentVariables.Desc: This returns the offset between the local time and Zulu Time. See the Note On Zulu Time for more information.

EnvironmentVariables.Name: TIME OF DAY
EnvironmentVariables.Desc: This will return an integer value representing the approximate time of day where: 0 = dawn 1 = day 2 = dusk 3 = night

EnvironmentVariables.Name: TOOLTIP UNITS
EnvironmentVariables.Desc: This will return an integer value representing the current units used to display tooltip information, where: 0 = default 1 = metric (SI) 2 = US (imperial)

EnvironmentVariables.Name: UNITS OF MEASURE
EnvironmentVariables.Desc: This indicates the units used to express measurements and will return an integer value representing the following: 0 - English 1 - Metric with altitude in feet 2 - Metric with altitude in meters

EnvironmentVariables.Name: SIMULATION RATE
EnvironmentVariables.Desc: This is used to get/set the internal rate of passing time within the simulation(independently of the visual frame rate). The value will be clamped between 0.0625 and 128, and a value of 1 means that 1 second of game time is the same as 1 second of "real" time, and lower values will make the game time slower, and higher values will make the game time faster. Values are always multiples of two starting at 0.0625, so you can have: 0.0625, 0.125, 0.25, 0.5, 1, 2, 4, ... 128

EnvironmentVariables.Name: SIMULATION TIME
EnvironmentVariables.Desc: This returns a value for the seconds since the simulation has been started.

EnvironmentVariables.Name: SIMULATION DELTA TIME
EnvironmentVariables.Desc: This returns a value for the time passed between the last simulation frame and the current one.

EnvironmentVariables.Name: IS IN VR
EnvironmentVariables.Desc: This returns either 1 (TRUE) ir 0 (FALSE) to indicate whether the simulation is in VR mode or not.

AutopilotEvents.Name: AP_MANAGED_SPEED_IN_MACH_ON

AutopilotEvents.Name: AP_MANAGED_SPEED_IN_MACH_TOGGLE

AutopilotEvents.Name: AP_MAX_BANK_ANGLE_SET
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Set the bank angle for the aircraft and override the predefined max bank angle of the aircraft.

AutopilotEvents.Name: AP_MAX_BANK_INC
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Increment the AP max bank angle index. Note: that if there is only one index possible then using this event will do nothing.

AutopilotEvents.Name: AP_MAX_BANK_DEC
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Decrement the AP max bank angle index. Note: that if there is only one index possible then using this event will do nothing.

AutopilotEvents.Name: AP_MAX_BANK_SET
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Sets the autopilot max bank angle index value, where the value is clamped between 0 and the number of available indices. The indices correspond to the number of values set for the max_bank table, plus index 0 which corresponds to the auto banking system. When auto_max_bank is enabled, setting the index to 0 will turn on the AP auto banking. 0: use auto banking 1: use the first value in the max_bank table 2: use the second value in the max_bank table.

AutopilotEvents.Name: AP_MAX_BANK_VELOCITY_SET
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Set the bank velocity of the aircraft and overrides the predifined maximum bank velocity of the aircraft.

AutopilotEvents.Name: AP_N1_REF_INC

AutopilotEvents.Name: AP_N1_REF_SET

AutopilotEvents.Desc: Set the airspeed reference, in knots, for the maintain speed AP mode. The speed supplied will be divided by 100 to give you more precision with the value, for example: giving 55050 will result in an airspeed hold of 550.50 knots. For parameter [1], giving a value of 0 instead of a single index from 1 to 4, then the speed value will be copied to all managed indices.

AutopilotEvents.Name: AP_VS_ON
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Turn on the AP mode that maintains a vertical speed.

AutopilotEvents.Name: AP_VS_SET
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Sets the AP mode that maintains a vertical speed.

AutopilotEvents.Desc: Sets the current managed index vertical speed reference to be the current vertical speed (the current index can be set using AP_VS_SLOT_INDEX_SET). If no vertical speed indicator is on the aircraft, the vertical speed reference will calculated based on the world Y-axis velocity. Note that the resulting value will be clamped between the CFG parameters min_vertical_speed_ref and max_vertical_speed_ref.

AutopilotEvents.Name: AP_VS_VAR_SET_METRIC

AutopilotEvents.Desc: Turns off the autopilot FLC mode.

AutopilotEvents.Name: FLIGHT_LEVEL_CHANGE_ON
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Turn on the autopilot FLC mode. This mode adjusts engine power to fly the aircraft at a pitch attitude corresponding to the desired flight profile (climb or descent), while maintaining the airspeed reference.

AutopilotEvents.Name: VS_SLOT_INDEX_SET

AutopilotEvents.Name: AUTOBRAKE_HI_SET
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Sets the autobrake switch to the maximum position (ie: the auto_brakes number, so that the maximum braking force will be applied).

AutopilotEvents.Name: AUTOBRAKE_LO_SET
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Sets the autobrake switch to the minimum position (position 2, the first position after the off position).

AutopilotEvents.Name: AUTOBRAKE_MED_SET
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Sets the autobrake switch to a medium position (the exact position will depend on the number of autobreaks defined by the auto_brakes parameter).

AutopilotEvents.Name: DECREASE_AUTOBRAKE_CONTROL
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Decrements the autobrake level by 1. When the level reaches 0, autobreaks will be off, and the event will no longer decrement further.

AutopilotEvents.Name: FLY_BY_WIRE_ELAC_TOGGLE
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Turn on or off the fly by wire Elevators and Ailerons computer.

AutopilotEvents.Name: FLY_BY_WIRE_FAC_TOGGLE
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Turn on or off the fly by wire Flight Augmentation computer.

AutopilotEvents.Name: FLY_BY_WIRE_SEC_TOGGLE
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Turn on or off the fly by wire Spoilers and Elevators computer.

AutopilotEvents.Name: GPWS_SWITCH_TOGGLE
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Turn the ground proximity warning system (GPWS) on or off.

AutopilotEvents.Name: HEADING_BUG_DEC
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Decrements heading hold reference bug

AutopilotEvents.Name: HEADING_BUG_INC
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Increments heading hold reference bug

AutopilotEvents.Name: HEADING_BUG_SELECT
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Selects the heading bug for use with +/-

AutopilotEvents.Name: HEADING_BUG_SET
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Set the heading hold reference bug in degrees. The event takes integer values only, from 0Âº to 360Âº.

AutopilotEvents.Name: AP_HEADING_BUG_SET_EX1
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Set the heading hold reference bug. This is the same as the HEADING_BUG_SET event only it permits a much greater degree of precision by permitting the input of a larger integer value that is then transformed by the simulation into a floating point heading. The way this works is that the integer value you supply is multiplied by (360/16384) to give the correct higher precision value

AutopilotEvents.Name: INCREASE_AUTOBRAKE_CONTROL
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Increases the autobrake level by 1. When the level reaches the auto_brakes value, the event will no longer increment further.

AutopilotEvents.Name: SET_AUTOBRAKE_CONTROL
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Uses the input parameter [0] to set the autobreak level from 0 (off) to the value set for the auto_brakes parameter (maximum breaking). If a value greater than that specified for auto_brakes is given as input, it will be clamped to the auto_brakes value.

AutopilotEvents.Name: SYNC_FLIGHT_DIRECTOR_PITCH
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Synchronizes flight director pitch with current aircraft pitch

AutopilotEvents.Name: TOGGLE_FLIGHT_DIRECTOR
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Toggles flight director on/off

AutopilotEvents.Name: YAW_DAMPER_TOGGLE
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Toggles yaw damper on/off

AutopilotEvents.Name: YAW_DAMPER_ON
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Turns yaw damper on

AutopilotEvents.Name: YAW_DAMPER_OFF
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Turns yaw damper off

AutopilotEvents.Name: YAW_DAMPER_SET
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Sets yaw damper on/off (1,0)

AutopilotEvents.Name: VSI_BUG_SELECT
AutopilotEvents.Desc: Selects the vertical speed reference for use with +/-

ElectricalEvents.Name: ALTERNATOR_OFF
ElectricalEvents.Desc: Turns the indexed alternator off. The alternator index is the N index of the alternator.N definition.

ElectricalEvents.Name: ALTERNATOR_ON
ElectricalEvents.Desc: Turns the indexed alternator on. The alternator index is the N index of the alternator.N definition.

ElectricalEvents.Name: ALTERNATOR_SET
ElectricalEvents.Desc: Sets the indexed alternator. The alternator index is the N index of the alternator.N definition.

ElectricalEvents.Name: ELECTRICAL_ALTERNATOR_BREAKER_TOGGLE
ElectricalEvents.Desc: Toggle the alternator breaker state with a bus. Takes two indices, the bus and the alternator index (see SimVars And Keys for more information). The bus index is the N index of the bus.N definition, and the alternator index is the N index of the alternator.N definition.

SystemEvents.Name: 1sec
SystemEvents.Desc: Request a notification every second.

SystemEvents.Name: 4sec
SystemEvents.Desc: Request a notification every four seconds.

SystemEvents.Name: 6Hz
SystemEvents.Desc: Request notifications six times per second. This is the same rate that joystick movement events are transmitted.

SystemEvents.Name: AircraftLoaded
SystemEvents.Desc: Request a notification when the aircraft flight dynamics file is changed. These files have a .AIR extension. The filename is returned in a SIMCONNECT_RECV_EVENT_FILENAME structure.

SystemEvents.Name: Crashed
SystemEvents.Desc: Request a notification if the user aircraft crashes.

SystemEvents.Name: CrashReset
SystemEvents.Desc: Request a notification when the crash cut-scene has completed.

SystemEvents.Name: FlightLoaded
SystemEvents.Desc: Request a notification when a flight is loaded. Note that when a flight is ended, a default flight is typically loaded, so these events will occur when flights and missions are started and finished. The filename of the flight loaded is returned in a SIMCONNECT_RECV_EVENT_FILENAME structure.

SystemEvents.Name: FlightSaved
SystemEvents.Desc: Request a notification when a flight is saved correctly. The filename of the flight saved is returned in a SIMCONNECT_RECV_EVENT_FILENAME structure.

SystemEvents.Name: FlightPlanActivated
SystemEvents.Desc: Request a notification when a new flight plan is activated. The filename of the activated flight plan is returned in a SIMCONNECT_RECV_EVENT_FILENAME structure.

SystemEvents.Name: FlightPlanDeactivated
SystemEvents.Desc: Request a notification when the active flight plan is de-activated.

SystemEvents.Name: Frame
SystemEvents.Desc: Request notifications every visual frame. Information is returned in a SIMCONNECT_RECV_EVENT structure.

SystemEvents.Name: ObjectAdded
SystemEvents.Desc: Request a notification when an AI object is added to the simulation. Refer also to the SIMCONNECT_RECV_EVENT_OBJECT_ADDREMOVE structure.

SystemEvents.Name: ObjectRemoved
SystemEvents.Desc: Request a notification when an AI object is removed from the simulation. Refer also to the SIMCONNECT_RECV_EVENT_OBJECT_ADDREMOVE structure.

SystemEvents.Name: Pause
SystemEvents.Desc: Request notifications when the flight is paused or unpaused, and also immediately returns the current pause state (1 = paused or 0 = unpaused). The state is returned in the dwData parameter.

SystemEvents.Name: Pause_EX1
SystemEvents.Desc: Request notifications when the flight is paused or unpaused, and also immediately returns the current pause state with more detail than the regular Pause system event. The state is returned in the dwData parameter, and will be one of the following defines: #define PAUSE_STATE_FLAG_OFF 0 // No Pause #define PAUSE_STATE_FLAG_PAUSE 1 // "full" Pause (sim + traffic + etc...) #define PAUSE_STATE_FLAG_PAUSE_WITH_SOUND 2 // FSX Legacy Pause (not used anymore) #define PAUSE_STATE_FLAG_ACTIVE_PAUSE 4 // Pause was activated using the "Active Pause" Button #define PAUSE_STATE_FLAG_SIM_PAUSE 8 // Pause the player sim but traffic, multi, etc... will still run

SystemEvents.Name: Paused
SystemEvents.Desc: Request a notification when the flight is paused.

SystemEvents.Name: PauseFrame
SystemEvents.Desc: Request notifications for every visual frame that the simulation is paused. Information is returned in a SIMCONNECT_RECV_EVENT structure.

SystemEvents.Name: PositionChanged
SystemEvents.Desc: Request a notification when the user changes the position of their aircraft through a dialog.

SystemEvents.Name: Sim
SystemEvents.Desc: Request notifications when the flight is running or not, and also immediately returns the current state (1 = running or 0 = not running). The state is returned in the dwData parameter.

SystemEvents.Name: SimStart
SystemEvents.Desc: The simulator is running. Typically the user is actively controlling the aircraft on the ground or in the air. However, in some cases additional pairs of SimStart/SimStop events are sent. For example, when a flight is reset the events that are sent are SimStop, SimStart, SimStop, SimStart. Also when a flight is started with the SHOW_OPENING_SCREEN value set to zero, then an additional SimStart/SimStop pair are sent before a second SimStart event is sent when the scenery is fully loaded. The opening screen provides the options to change aircraft, departure airport, and so on.

SystemEvents.Name: SimStop
SystemEvents.Desc: The simulator is not running. Typically the user is loading a flight, navigating the shell or in a dialog.

SystemEvents.Name: Sound
SystemEvents.Desc: Requests a notification when the master sound switch is changed. This request will also return the current state of the master sound switch immediately. A flag is returned in the dwData parameter, 0 if the switch is off, SIMCONNECT_SOUND_SYSTEM_EVENT_DATA_MASTER (0x1) if the switch is on.

SystemEvents.Name: Unpaused
SystemEvents.Desc: Request a notification when the flight is un-paused.

SystemEvents.Name: View
SystemEvents.Desc: Requests a notification when the user aircraft view is changed. This request will also return the current view immediately. A flag is returned in the dwData parameter, one of: SIMCONNECT_VIEW_SYSTEM_EVENT_DATA_COCKPIT_2D SIMCONNECT_VIEW_SYSTEM_EVENT_DATA_COCKPIT_VIRTUAL SIMCONNECT_VIEW_SYSTEM_EVENT_DATA_ORTHOGONAL (the map view).

LandingGearEvents.Name: ANTISKID_BRAKES_TOGGLE
LandingGearEvents.Desc: Turn the anti-skid braking system on or off.

LandingGearEvents.Name: AXIS_LEFT_BRAKE_SET
LandingGearEvents.Desc: Sets the left brake position from an axis controller (e.g. joystick) to the value given as the parameter [0], from -16383 (0 braking) to +16383 (maximum braking). Note that this is on a non-linear scale:  -16383 = 0%   -8191 = 8%   0 = 27%   +8191 = 53%   +16383 = 100%

LandingGearEvents.Name: AXIS_RIGHT_BRAKE_SET
LandingGearEvents.Desc: Sets the right brake position from an axis controller (e.g. joystick) to the value given as the parameter [0], from -16383 (0 braking) to +16383 (maximum braking). Note that this is on a non-linear scale:  -16383 = 0%   -8191 = 8%   0 = 27%   +8191 = 53%   +16383 = 100%

LandingGearEvents.Name: GEAR_DOWN
LandingGearEvents.Desc: Sets gear handle in DOWN position

LandingGearEvents.Name: GEAR_UP
LandingGearEvents.Desc: Sets gear handle in UP position

LandingGearEvents.Name: RETRACT_FLOAT_SWITCH_DEC
LandingGearEvents.Desc: If the plane has retractable floats, moves the retract position from Extend to Neutral, or Neutral to Retract.

LandingGearEvents.Name: RETRACT_FLOAT_SWITCH_INC
LandingGearEvents.Desc: If the plane has retractable floats, moves the retract position from Retract to Neutral, or Neutral to Extend.
